nl.weeaboo.vn.layout

Class LayoutSize

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.weeaboo.vn.layout.LayoutSize
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public final class LayoutSize
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Wrapper around a layout-related size value. Makes encoding of infinite values more explicit.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • ZERO

        public static LayoutSize ZERO

      • UNKNOWN

    • Method Detail

      • of

        public static LayoutSize of(double value)
        Converts a double value to a corresponding LayoutSize object.
        • 0.0 maps to ZERO
        • Positive, finite values map to the corresponding finite layout size
        • Negative, finite values are illegal
        • POSITIVE_INFINITY maps to INFINITE
        • NEGATIVE_INFINITY is an illegal argument
        • NaN maps to UNKNOWN

      • isInfinite

        public boolean isInfinite()
        Returns:
        true if this is an infinite size.
        See Also:
        INFINITE

      • isUnknown

        public boolean isUnknown()
        Returns:
        true if this is an unknown size.
        See Also:
        UNKNOWN

      • value

        public double value()
        Converts the layout size to a finite number. Note that this method is not the inverse operation of of(double).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If this layout size doesn't represent a finite number.
        See Also:
        value(double)

      • value

        public double value(double defaultValue)
        Returns:
        The size value, or defaultValue if infinite or unknown.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • min

        public static LayoutSize min(LayoutSize a,
                             LayoutSize b)
        Returns the smallest of two layout sizes.

        Unlike Math.min(double, double) if one of the values is UNKNOWN, the other value is returned and not necessarily UNKNOWN.

      • max

        public static LayoutSize max(LayoutSize a,
                             LayoutSize b)
        Returns the largest of two layout sizes.

        Unlike Math.max(double, double) if one of the values is UNKNOWN, the other value is returned and not necessarily UNKNOWN.
